public class

SearchController

extends Object
java.lang.Object
   ↳ com.google.android.apps.auto.sdk.SearchController

Class Overview

Controls the keyboard search experience.

To add search to your app:

  • Provide a SearchCallback using setSearchCallback(SearchCallback). This will handle suggestions for the currently entered text and perform a search when submitted.
  • Make the search box visible by calling showSearchBox().
The typical life cycle of search:
  • onSearchStart() is called when the user opens search.
  • onSearchTextChanged(String) is called when the user types in a new search term.
  • onSearchSubmitted(String) is called when the user submits a search term, or selects a search suggestion.
  • onSearchItemSelected(SearchItem) is called when the user selects a search item.
  • onSearchStop() is called when the user closes search.

Summary

Public Methods
void hideSearchBox()
Hides the search box.
void setSearchCallback(SearchCallback searchCallback)
Sets a SearchCallback, which allows the app to listen to search events such as start/stop/textChanged.
void setSearchHint(CharSequence searchHint)
Sets the search hint to be displayed (in the large search box in the search screen) when the edit text is empty.
void setSearchItems(List<SearchItem> searchItems)
Sets the search items to be displayed in the Search screen.
void showSearchBox()
Shows the search box.
void startSearch(String searchTerm)
Starts the search with specific search term.
void stopSearch()
Exits the search experience and show the original app's content view again.

Public Methods

public void hideSearchBox ()

Hides the search box. Valid only when search is not activated.

Throws
IllegalStateException If no SearchCallback is set using setSearchCallback(SearchCallback).

public void setSearchCallback (SearchCallback searchCallback)

Sets a SearchCallback, which allows the app to listen to search events such as start/stop/textChanged.

Parameters
searchCallback SearchCallback: The search callback, or null to remove the current search callback.

public void setSearchHint (CharSequence searchHint)

Sets the search hint to be displayed (in the large search box in the search screen) when the edit text is empty.

Parameters
searchHint CharSequence

public void setSearchItems (List<SearchItem> searchItems)

Sets the search items to be displayed in the Search screen. Typically called when onSearchTextChanged(String) is called to deliver an updated list of SearchItem. Can be called multiple times as long as the Search screen is showing (it has no effect if called when the Search screen is not activated). Valid only between onSearchStart() (inclusive) and onSearchStop() (exclusive).

Parameters
searchItems List: The list of search items to be displayed. The list can include both results and suggestions.
Throws
IllegalArgumentException If searchItems is null.

public void showSearchBox ()

Shows the search box. Valid only when search is not activated.

Throws
IllegalStateException If no SearchCallback is set using setSearchCallback(SearchCallback).

public void startSearch (String searchTerm)

Starts the search with specific search term.

Parameters
searchTerm String
Throws
IllegalStateException If no SearchCallback is set using setSearchCallback(SearchCallback).

public void stopSearch ()

Exits the search experience and show the original app's content view again.

Throws
IllegalStateException If no SearchCallback is set using setSearchCallback(SearchCallback).
